author: Matt Bassil
description:
The much-awaited Pokémon TCG release Destined Rivals came out for English-speaking audiences on May 30, and as we see every time a set drops, prices tanked immediately to way below their presale levels.

However, while the value of some cards have cratered, others have bounced back surprisingly quickly, even surpassing the original estimates. Below, you’ll find the details on the two cards from the set which are currently spiking, not dropping in price.

Continue reading Destined Rivals Pokémon cards are plummeting in price - except for these two
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards,
title: Destined Rivals Pokémon cards are plummeting in price - except for these two

author: Alex Evans
description:
Traps are one of those elements of every DnD campaign that you can't really do without, but which can so easily become formulaic, predictable, and perfunctory. Sure, a tripwire that drops a guillotine from above has old school fantasy flavor and reminds your players to stay on their toes, but we've seen it all before. Traps don't have to just be an obstacle on the way to the prize - they can (and should) be memorable moments in their own right. As inspiration, we've cooked up three little creations that'll take more than a quick acrobatics check to get past.

Continue reading Three horrendous homebrew DnD traps to haunt your players' dreams
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide,
title: Three horrendous homebrew DnD traps to haunt your players' dreams

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Fantasy Flight Games has announced a new constructed format for the Star Wars Unlimited trading card game, and its the most interesting competitive format I’ve seen from any major TCG in far too long. ‘Trilogy’ is a best-of-three format which requires players to build three distinct decks – but that’s only the first layer of nuance that makes this into a genuinely exciting deck-building challenge.

Continue reading The Star Wars TCG just revealed the best constructed format I've seen in years
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best card games, Best Trading Card Games, MTG release schedule
title: The Star Wars TCG just revealed the best constructed format I've seen in years

author: Chloe Ward
description:
If, like me, you're hopelessly in love with Disney Lorcana, the chances are you're constantly looking to improve your decks, dive deeper into Lorcana lore, and maybe scoop some rarer cards for your binders. For all these things, booster packs are the way to go, and at the moment, you can get your hands on 24 boosters - that's 288 cards in total - from the Archazia’s Island set for just under 25% off on Amazon.

Continue reading Nab a full Disney Lorcana Archazia's Island booster box for less than $110
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How to play Lorcana, Best Lorcana starter decks, Most expensive Lorcana cards
title: Nab a full Disney Lorcana Archazia's Island booster box for less than $110

author: Matt Bassil
description:
David Thompson and Trevor Benjamin, the board game designers behind Osprey Games’ hit Undaunted series, have just unveiled their latest project, Moytura, a two player game about vying for control of Ancient Ireland with the help of various deities.

Continue reading Undaunted creators' new board game is a strategy battle infused with Irish myths
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Undaunted creators' new board game is a strategy battle infused with Irish myths

author: Timothy Linward
description:
"Was the idea a dream or a nightmare? I'm not too sure," UK based Warhammer 40k fan Mark ‘TheTabletopSmithy’ Smith wonders, as he tries to recall the origin of his latest creation: an Ork Gorkanaut war walker built around the chattering, blinking, rocking frame of a toy Furby.

Continue reading Emperor protect us, the Warhammer 40k Furbork is real and it is CURSED
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: Emperor protect us, the Warhammer 40k Furbork is real and it is CURSED

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The first preview MTG card for the upcoming space fantasy set, Edge of Eternities, has been revealed, and it is an extremely pushed planeswalker. We already knew Tezzeret was lined up to be this set’s primary villain, and now his card has been shown off - apparently in a VIP event at Magiccon Vegas.

Continue reading MTG's busted new Tezzeret card is on the fast track to a Legacy ban
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG's busted new Tezzeret card is on the fast track to a Legacy ban
